name: American Pie
tuning: E A D G B E

content.text:
* - strum once

[Verse 1]

  [ch]G[/ch]     [ch]D/F#[/ch]    [ch]Em7[/ch]
A long, long time ago,
[ch]Am[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]                  [ch]Em[/ch]                  [ch]D[/ch]
I can still remember how that music used to make me smile
    [ch]G[/ch]      [ch]D/F#[/ch]   [ch]Em7[/ch]
And I know if I had my chance,
     [ch]Am[/ch]                 [ch]C[/ch]                [ch]Em[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]D[/ch]
That I could make those people dance and maybe they'd be happy for a while
    [ch]Em[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]Em[/ch]                 [ch]Am[/ch]
But February made me shiver, with every paper I'd deliver
[ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]      [ch]Am[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]                     [ch]D[/ch]
Bad news on the doorstep, I couldn't take one more step
  [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]D/F#[/ch]     [ch]Em[/ch]           [ch]Am7[/ch]            [ch]D[/ch]
I can't remember if I cried when I read about his widowed bride
[ch]G[/ch]         [ch]D[/ch]          [ch]Em[/ch]
Something touched me deep inside
    [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D7[/ch]      [ch]G[/ch]
The day the music died


[Chorus]

   [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]D[/ch]
So bye, bye Miss American Pie
         [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]D[/ch]
Drove my Chevy to the levy but the levy was dry
         [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]                  [ch]G[/ch]           [ch]D[/ch]
And them good old boys were drinkin' whiskey and rye
        [ch]Em[/ch]*                         [ch]A7[/ch]*   [ch]Em[/ch]*                         [ch]D7[/ch]
Singin' this will be the day that I die, this will be the day that I die


[Verse 2]

[ch]G[/ch]                 [ch]Am[/ch]
Did you write the book of love
       [ch]C[/ch]                 [ch]Am[/ch]         [ch]Em[/ch]           [ch]D[/ch]
And do you have faith in god above, if the bible tells you so?
[ch]G[/ch]      [ch]D/F#[/ch]        [ch]Em[/ch]
Do you believe in rock and roll
    [ch]Am7[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]              [ch]Em[/ch]                 [ch]A7[/ch]           [ch]D[/ch]
Can music save your mortal soul and can you teach me how to dance real slow?
       [ch]Em[/ch]*                  [ch]D[/ch]*                   [ch]Em[/ch]*             [ch]D[/ch]*
Well I know that you're in love with him 'cuz I saw you dancin' in the gym
    [ch]C[/ch]           [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]A7[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]                    [ch]D7[/ch]
You both kicked off your shoes, man I dig those rhythm and blues
        [ch]G[/ch]      [ch]D/F#[/ch]     [ch]Em[/ch]                   [ch]Am[/ch]                   [ch]C[/ch]
I was a lonely teenage broncin' buck with a pink carnation and a pickup truck
    [ch]G[/ch]     [ch]D/F#[/ch]    [ch]Em[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]D7[/ch]    [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]
But I knew I was out of luck the day the music died, I started singin'


[Chorus]

   [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]D[/ch]
So bye, bye Miss American Pie
         [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]D[/ch]
Drove my Chevy to the levy but the levy was dry
         [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]                  [ch]G[/ch]           [ch]D[/ch]
And them good old boys were drinkin' whiskey and rye
        [ch]Em[/ch]*                         [ch]A7[/ch]*   [ch]Em[/ch]*                         [ch]D7[/ch]
Singin' this will be the day that I die, this will be the day that I die


[Verse 3]

         [ch]G[/ch]                   [ch]Am[/ch]
Now for ten years we've been on our own,
      [ch]C[/ch]                   [ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]Em[/ch]                     [ch]D[/ch]
and moss grows fat on a rolling stone but that's not how it used to be
          [ch]G[/ch]     [ch]D/F#[/ch]            [ch]Em[/ch]
When the jester sang for the king and queen 
     [ch]Am7[/ch]                [ch]C[/ch]                   [ch]Em[/ch]             [ch]A7[/ch]          [ch]D[/ch]
in a coat he borrowed from James Dean in a voice that came from you and me
     [ch]Em[/ch]*                 [ch]D[/ch]*               [ch]Em[/ch]*                 [ch]D[/ch]*
And while the king was looking down, the jester stole his thorny crown
     [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]A7[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]             [ch]D7[/ch]
The courtroom was adjourned, no verdict was returned
          [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]D/F#[/ch]  [ch]Em[/ch]             [ch]Am[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]
And while Lenin read a book on Marx, the quartet practiced in the park
    [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]D/F#[/ch]   [ch]Em[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]         [ch]D7[/ch]     [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]
And we sang dirges in the dark the day the music died, we were singin'


[Chorus]

   [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]D[/ch]
So bye, bye Miss American Pie
         [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]D[/ch]
Drove my Chevy to the levy but the levy was dry
         [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]                  [ch]G[/ch]           [ch]D[/ch]
And them good old boys were drinkin' whiskey and rye
        [ch]Em[/ch]*                         [ch]A7[/ch]*   [ch]Em[/ch]*                         [ch]D7[/ch]
Singin' this will be the day that I die, this will be the day that I die


[Verse 4]

[ch]G[/ch]                   [ch]Am[/ch]
Helter skelter in a summer swelter
[ch]C[/ch]                      [ch]Am[/ch]                 [ch]Em[/ch]                     [ch]D[/ch]
the birds flew off with a fallout shelter, eight miles high and fallin' fast
      [ch]G[/ch]   [ch]D/F#[/ch]  [ch]Em[/ch]
It landed foul on the grass
      [ch]Am7[/ch]                [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]Em[/ch]                             [ch]A7[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]
the players tried for a forward pass, with the jester on the sidelines in a cast
         [ch]Em[/ch]*               [ch]D[/ch]*                  [ch]Em[/ch]*                 [ch]D[/ch]*
Now at halftime there was sweet perfume, while sergeants played a marching tune
[ch]C[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]A7[/ch]      [ch]C[/ch]                  [ch]D7[/ch]
We all got up to dance, but we never got the chance
          [ch]G[/ch]      [ch]D/F#[/ch]      [ch]Em[/ch]                 [ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]
'Cuz the players tried to take the field, the marching band refused to yield
    [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]D/F#[/ch]       [ch]Em[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]D7[/ch]       [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]
Do you recall what was the feel the day the music died,    we started singin'


[Chorus]

   [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]D[/ch]
So bye, bye Miss American Pie
         [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]D[/ch]

         [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]                  [ch]G[/ch]           [ch]D[/ch]

        [ch]Em[/ch]*                         [ch]A7[/ch]*   [ch]Em[/ch]*                         [ch]D7[/ch]
Singin' this will be the day that I die, this will be the day that I die


[Verse 5]

     [ch]G[/ch]                [ch]Am[/ch]
And there we were all in one place,
    [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]            [ch]Em[/ch]                   [ch]D[/ch]
a generation lost in space, with no time left to start again
            [ch]G[/ch]      [ch]D/F#[/ch]   [ch]Em[/ch]               [ch]Am7[/ch]                 [ch]C[/ch]
So come on Jack be nimble, Jack be quick, Jack Flash sat on a candle 
       [ch]Em[/ch]                   [ch]A7[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]
stick, 'cuz fire is the devil's only friend
     [ch]Em[/ch]*              [ch]D[/ch]*               [ch]Em[/ch]*                    [ch]D[/ch]*
And as I watched him on the stage, my hands were clenched in fists of rage
   [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]A7[/ch]         [ch]C[/ch]                  [ch]D7[/ch]
No angel born in Hell could break that Satan's spell
           [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]D/F#[/ch]      [ch]Em[/ch]             [ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]
And as the flames climbed high into the night to light the sacrificial rite
       [ch]G[/ch]   [ch]D/F#[/ch]           [ch]Em[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D7[/ch]      [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]

        [ch]Em[/ch]*                         [ch]A7[/ch]*   [ch]Em[/ch]*                         [ch]D7[/ch]

[Verse 6]

  [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]D/F#[/ch]       [ch]Em[/ch]
I met a girl who sang the blues
      [ch]Am[/ch]                 [ch]C[/ch]               [ch]Em[/ch]                      [ch]D[/ch]
And I asked her for some happy news, but she just smiled and turned away
  [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]D/F#[/ch]      [ch]Em[/ch]
I went down to the sacred store
       [ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]                     [ch]Em[/ch]                 [ch]C[/ch]
Where I'd heard the music years before, but the man there said the music
         [ch]D[/ch]
wouldn't play
    [ch]Em[/ch]*                [ch]Am[/ch]*                    [ch]Em[/ch]*                  [ch]Am[/ch]*
But in the streets the children screamed, the lovers cried and the poets dreamed
    [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]                     [ch]D[/ch]
But not a word was spoken, the church bells all were broken 
        [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]D/F#[/ch]   [ch]Em[/ch]            [ch]Am7[/ch]     [ch]C[/ch]             [ch]D7[/ch]
And the three men I admire most, the Father, Son, and the Holy Ghost
[ch]G[/ch]             [ch]D/F#[/ch]          [ch]Em[/ch]               [ch]Am7[/ch]     [ch]D7[/ch]    [ch]G[/ch]
They caught the last train for the coast the day the music died,
N.C.
And they were singin'

   [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]D[/ch]
Bye, bye, bye Miss American Pie,

         [ch]Em[/ch]                          [ch]A7[/ch]

[ch]Em[/ch]                          [ch]D7[/ch]

             [ch]D7[/ch]

  [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]D[/ch]
Bye, bye, bye Miss American Pie,
         [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]D[/ch]

(End)


Notes:
1. This version was borne out frustration to get this to match the Live performance. 
2. In 2001 "American Pie" was voted No. 5 in a poll of the 365 Songs of the 
Century compiled by the Recording Industry Association of America and the National 
Endowment for the Arts.

  to rhythm)

  different voices

[Verse 1]
                    [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]Gsus4[/ch] [ch]G[/ch]                    [ch]Am[/ch]     
Starry, starry  night,   paint your palette blue and grey
                [ch]C[/ch]                 [ch]D[/ch]                                [ch]G[/ch]    
Look out on a summer's day, with eyes that know the darkness in my soul
                   [ch]G[/ch] [ch]Gsus4[/ch] [ch]G[/ch]                       [ch]Am[/ch]
Shadows on the hills,       Sketch the trees and daffodills
                      [ch]C[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch]                             [ch]G[/ch]
Catch the breeze and winter chills, in colors on the snowy linen land      
         
[Chorus]
            [ch]Am[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]                   [ch]G[/ch]         [ch]G/F#[/ch] [ch]Em[/ch]
And now I understand what you tried to say to me,
                          [ch]Am[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]                          [ch]Em[/ch]
How you suffered for your sanity How you tried to set them free,     
                                     [ch]A[/ch]          [ch]Am[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]                 [ch]G[/ch]       
They would not listen, they did not know how,  Perhaps they'll listen now
   
[Verse 2]                     
                        [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]Gsus4[/ch] [ch]G[/ch]                    [ch]Am[/ch]                     
Starry, starry  night,          flaming flowers that Brightly blaze, 
                   [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]D[/ch]                                    [ch]G[/ch]    
Swirling clouds in violet haze Reflecting Vincent’s eyes of China Blue
                    [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]Gsus4[/ch] [ch]G[/ch]                        [ch]Am[/ch]     
Colors changing hue,               Morning fields of amber grain
               [ch]C[/ch]                     [ch]D[/ch]                                  [ch]G[/ch]
Weathered faces lined with pain Are soothed beneath the artists loving hand

[Chorus]
            [ch]Am[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]                   [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]G/F#[/ch] [ch]Em[/ch]
And now I understand what you tried to say to me,
                          [ch]Am[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]                          [ch]Em[/ch]
How you suffered for your sanity How you tried to set them free,     
                                     [ch]A[/ch]          [ch]Am[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]               [ch]G[/ch]       
They would not listen, they did not know how,  Perhaps they'll listen now
   
   
[Bridge]
                    [ch]Am[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]                          [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]G/F#[/ch]          [ch]Em[/ch]
For they could not love you, but still your love was true
             [ch]Am[/ch]                             [ch]Cm[/ch]
And when no hope was left in sight On that starry, starry night, 
     [ch]G[/ch]                 [ch]F[/ch]             [ch]E7[/ch]
You took your life as lovers oftern do
       [ch]Am[/ch]                                 [ch]C[/ch]     
But I could have told you, Vincent, this world was 
                        [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]G[/ch]
Never meant for one as beautiful as  you

[Verse 3]
                    [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]Gsus4[/ch] [ch]G[/ch]                                 [ch]Am[/ch]            
Starry, starry  night,                portraits hung in empty halls,  
                  [ch]C[/ch]                   [ch]D[/ch]                                  [ch]G[/ch]    
Frames heads on nameless walls with eyes that watch the world and can’t forget
                                 [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]Gsus4[/ch] [ch]G[/ch]                        [ch]Am[/ch]
Like the strangers that you’ve met              The ragged men in ragged clothes 
                      [ch]C[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch]                               [ch]G[/ch]
The silver thorn of bloody rose, lie Crushed and broken on the virgin snow

[Chorus]
                  [ch]Am[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]                   [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]G/F#[/ch] [ch]Em[/ch]
And now I think I know what you tried to say to me,
                          [ch]Am[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]                          [ch]Em[/ch]
How you suffered for your sanity How you tried to set them free,      
                                      [ch]A[/ch]            [ch]Am[/ch]   [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]G[/ch]       
They would not listen, they’re not listening still, perhaps the never will

Hey Guys, I just fixed up an existing tab, purely because the second and third verses did not have the 
chords, and when playing live (if you have not played it before) it's good to have the chords throughout
the tab!
www.markcrotti.com.au

[Verse 1]
               [ch]G[/ch]
Starry, starry night
                   [ch]Am[/ch]
Paint your pallet blue and grey
              [ch]C[/ch]                 [ch]D7[/ch]                               [ch]G[/ch]
Look out on a summer's day with eyes that know the darkness in my soul
                                             [ch]Am[/ch]
Shadows on the hills, sketch the trees and the daffodils
                         [ch]C[/ch]                 [ch]D7[/ch]                         [ch]G[/ch] - [ch]C[/ch] - [ch]G[/ch]
Catch the breeze and the winter chills, in colours on the snowy linen land

[Chorus]
              [ch]Am[/ch]     [ch]D7[/ch]                   [ch]G[/ch]        [ch]Em[/ch]
And now I understand    what you tried to say to me
                         [ch]Am7[/ch]     [ch]D7[/ch]                           [ch]Em[/ch]
How you suffered for your sanity     How you tried to set them free
                                [ch]A7[/ch]          [ch]Am7[/ch] - [ch]D7[/ch]           [ch]G[/ch]
They would not listen, they did not know how   perhaps they listen now

[Verse 2]
               [ch]G[/ch]
Starry, starry night
                [ch]Am[/ch]
Flaming flowers that brightly blaze
                  [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]D7[/ch]                                [ch]G[/ch]
Swirling clouds in violet haze reflect in Vincent's eyes of china blue
                                      [ch]Am[/ch]
Colors changing hue, morning fields of amber grey
               [ch]C[/ch]                   [ch]D7[/ch]                                  [ch]G[/ch] - [ch]C[/ch] - [ch]G[/ch]
Weathered faces lined in pain, are soothed beneath the artist's loving hand

[Extended Chorus]
[ch]G[/ch]                 [ch]Am7[/ch]      [ch]D7[/ch]                        [ch]G[/ch]  -  [ch]Em[/ch]
For they could not love you,  but still your love was true
            [ch]Am7[/ch]                            [ch]Cm6[/ch]
And when no hope was left in sight on that starry, starry night
    [ch]G[/ch]                [ch]F7[/ch]           [ch]E7[/ch]         [ch]Am7[/ch]
You took your life as lovers often do,  But I could have told you Vincent
     [ch]C[/ch]                                [ch]D7[/ch]           [ch]G[/ch]
This world was never meant for one as beautiful as you

[Verse 3]
               [ch]G[/ch]
Starry, starry night
                  [ch]Am[/ch]
Portraits hung in empty halls
                   [ch]C[/ch]                     [ch]D7[/ch]                                  [ch]G[/ch]

                                                     [ch]Am[/ch]
Like the strangers that you've met, the ragged men in ragged clothes
                      [ch]C[/ch]                [ch]D7[/ch]                               [ch]G[/ch] - [ch]C[/ch] - [ch]G[/ch]

[Final Chorus]
                  [ch]Am[/ch]     [ch]D7[/ch]                  [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]Em[/ch]

                         [ch]Am7[/ch]     [ch]D7[/ch]                           [ch]Em[/ch]

For they could not love you 
                        [ch]Em[/ch]

            [ch]Am[/ch]
And when no hope was left inside 
        [ch]D7[/ch]
On that starry, starry night
    [ch]C[/ch]         [ch]Em[/ch]             [ch]Am[/ch]
You took your life as lovers often do
    [ch]Am[/ch]                    [ch]C[/ch]
But I could have told you Vincent
     [ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]               [ch]D7[/ch]
This world was never meant for one as
             [ch]G[/ch]
beautiful as you

[Verse 3]
               [ch]G[/ch]
Starry, starry night
                  [ch]Am[/ch]
Portraits hung in empty halls
                    [ch]C[/ch]
Frameless heads on nameless walls
     [ch]D7[/ch]                                  [ch]G[/ch]
With eyes that watch the world and can't forget
                               [ch]G[/ch]
Like the strangers that you've met
                  [ch]Am[/ch]
The ragged men in ragged clothes
                    [ch]C[/ch]
The silver thorn of bloody rose
    [ch]D7[/ch]                               [ch]G[/ch]
Lie crushed and broken on the virgin snow

[Pre-Chorus]
[ch]G[/ch]             [ch]Am[/ch]
Now I think I know
                  [ch]D7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]Em[/ch]
What you tried to say to me
                          [ch]Am[/ch]
How you suffered for your sanity
                 [ch]D7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]Em[/ch]
How you tried to set them free
                                 [ch]Am[/ch] 
They did not listen, They're not listening still
[ch]D7[/ch]                 [ch]G[/ch]
